segment.source: Identify the Number of MED-V Instances
segment.target: Identify the Number of MED-V Instances

segment.source: Identify the Number of MED-V Instances
segment.target: Identify the Number of MED-V Instances

segment.source: Identify the Number of MED-V Instances
segment.target: Identify the Number of MED-V Instances

segment.source: You need to determine the number of MED-V instances, as well as define the scope for each instance so that you can design the server infrastructure.
segment.target: You need to determine the number of MED-V instances, as well as define the scope for each instance so that you can design the server infrastructure.

segment.source: A MED-V instance includes the following:
segment.target: A MED-V instance includes the following:

segment.source: The MED-V server and the MED-V workspaces stored on the server, including Active Directory permissions.
segment.target: The MED-V server and the MED-V workspaces stored on the server, including Active Directory permissions.

segment.source: A SQL Server database that stores client events.
segment.target: A SQL Server database that stores client events.

segment.source: The database may be shared by multiple MED-V instances.
segment.target: The database may be shared by multiple MED-V instances.

segment.source: The image repository for the packed MED-V images.
segment.target: The image repository for the packed MED-V images.

segment.source: The repository may be shared by multiple MED-V instances.
segment.target: The repository may be shared by multiple MED-V instances.

segment.source: The management console used to create and pack images and to create MED-V workspaces.
segment.target: The management console used to create and pack images and to create MED-V workspaces.

segment.source: The console cannot be used simultaneously by multiple MED-V instances, but it can be disconnected from one MED-V server and then connected to a different MED-V server.
segment.target: The console cannot be used simultaneously by multiple MED-V instances, but it can be disconnected from one MED-V server and then connected to a different MED-V server.

segment.source: MED-V clients that receive MED-V workspaces, and authorization to use them, from the server.
segment.target: MED-V clients that receive MED-V workspaces, and authorization to use them, from the server.

segment.source: Separate MED-V instances cannot be integrated or share MED-V workspaces.
segment.target: Separate MED-V instances cannot be integrated or share MED-V workspaces.

segment.source: Therefore, each additional instance decentralizes the virtualization management.
segment.target: Therefore, each additional instance decentralizes the virtualization management.

segment.source: Determine the Number of MED-V Instances Required
segment.target: Determine the Number of MED-V Instances Required

segment.source: Start by assuming you are using one MED-V instance.
segment.target: Start by assuming you are using one MED-V instance.

segment.source: Then, consider the following conditions, and add additional instances for each condition that applies to your infrastructure.
segment.target: Then, consider the following conditions, and add additional instances for each condition that applies to your infrastructure.

segment.source: Number of supported users—Each MED-V instance can support up to 5,000 concurrently active clients.
segment.target: Number of supported users—Each MED-V instance can support up to 5,000 concurrently active clients.

segment.source: Concurrently active means the client is online with the MED-V server and sending polls to the server for policy and image updates, as well as events.
segment.target: Concurrently active means the client is online with the MED-V server and sending polls to the server for policy and image updates, as well as events.

segment.source: If your infrastructure will include more than 5,000 active users, add one instance for every 5,000 users.
segment.target: If your infrastructure will include more than 5,000 active users, add one instance for every 5,000 users.

segment.source: Users in untrusted domains—The MED-V server associates MED-V workspace permissions with Active Directory users and/or groups.
segment.target: Users in untrusted domains—The MED-V server associates MED-V workspace permissions with Active Directory users and/or groups.

segment.source: This requires MED-V users to exist within the trust boundary of the MED-V server.
segment.target: This requires MED-V users to exist within the trust boundary of the MED-V server.

segment.source: Add one MED-V instance for each group of MED-V users that is in a separate, untrusted domain.
segment.target: Add one MED-V instance for each group of MED-V users that is in a separate, untrusted domain.

segment.source: Clients in isolated networks—Determine whether any clients reside in networks that are isolated and therefore require a separate MED-V instance.
segment.target: Clients in isolated networks—Determine whether any clients reside in networks that are isolated and therefore require a separate MED-V instance.

segment.source: For example, organizations often isolate lab networks from production networks.
segment.target: For example, organizations often isolate lab networks from production networks.

segment.source: Add a MED-V instance for each isolated network that will contain MED-V clients.
segment.target: Add a MED-V instance for each isolated network that will contain MED-V clients.

segment.source: Organizational requirements—The organization may require that a group of clients be managed by a separate MED-V instance for security reasons, such as when sensitive applications are delivered only to a restricted set of users within a domain.
segment.target: Organizational requirements—The organization may require that a group of clients be managed by a separate MED-V instance for security reasons, such as when sensitive applications are delivered only to a restricted set of users within a domain.

segment.source: For example, the payroll department may deny users from other departments access to the MED-V instance that stores policy for payroll processing.
segment.target: For example, the payroll department may deny users from other departments access to the MED-V instance that stores policy for payroll processing.

segment.source: Additionally, if the organization uses a distributed management model, a separate MED-V instance may be required for each business group having MED-V clients in order to enable the group to manage its own virtualized environment.
segment.target: Additionally, if the organization uses a distributed management model, a separate MED-V instance may be required for each business group having MED-V clients in order to enable the group to manage its own virtualized environment.

segment.source: Add one MED-V instance for each separate organizational requirement.
segment.target: Add one MED-V instance for each separate organizational requirement.

segment.source: Legal considerations—National security or privacy issues and fiduciary laws could require the separation of certain data or prevent other data from crossing national borders.
segment.target: Legal considerations—National security or privacy issues and fiduciary laws could require the separation of certain data or prevent other data from crossing national borders.

segment.source: If necessary, add additional MED-V instances to address this need.
segment.target: If necessary, add additional MED-V instances to address this need.

segment.source: After you determine the number of MED-V instances required for your infrastructure, as well as the reasoning for each one, provide a name for each instance.
segment.target: After you determine the number of MED-V instances required for your infrastructure, as well as the reasoning for each one, provide a name for each instance.
